/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/0/CHANNEL.Description: Selects the digital trigger source signal.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/0/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/0/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/1/CHANNEL.Description: Selects the digital trigger source signal.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/1/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/AUXTRIGGERS/1/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/DATA.Description: A vector of 32-bit integers representing the values on the DIO interface as sampled by the AWG at 150 MHz.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/DELAY/INDEX.Description: Index of the bit on the DIO interface for which the delay should be changed.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/DELAY/VALUE.Description: Corresponding delay value to apply to the given bit of the DIO interface in units of 150 MHz clock cycles. Valid values are 0 to 3.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/ERROR/TIMING.Description: A 32-bit value indicating which bits on the DIO interface may have timing errors. A timing error is defined as an event where either the VALID or any of the data bits on the DIO interface change value at the same time as the STROBE bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/ERROR/WIDTH.Description: Indicates a width (i.e. jitter) error on either the STROBE (bit 0 of the value) or VALID bit (bit 1 of the result). A width error indicates that there was jitter detected on the given bit, meaning that an active period was either shorter or longer than the configured expected width.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/HIGHBITS.Description: 32-bit value indicating which bits on the 32-bit interface are detected as having a logic high value.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/LOWBITS.Description: 32-bit value indicating which bits on the 32-bit interface are detected as having a logic low value.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/MASK/SHIFT.Description: Defines the amount of bit shifting to apply for the DIO wave selection.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/MASK/VALUE.Description: Selects the DIO bits to be used for waveform selection in connection with playWaveDIO().

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/STATE.Description: When asserted, indicates that triggers are generated from the DIO interface to the AWG.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/STROBE/INDEX.Description: Selects the DIO index to be used as a trigger for the playback of a wave in connecton with waitDIOTrigger().

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/STROBE/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the strobe trigger.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/STROBE/WIDTH.Description: Specifies the expected width of active pulses on the STROBE bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/VALID/INDEX.Description: Index on the 32-bit of the DIO bus to be used as a VALID bit, i.e. a qualifier indicating that a valid codeword is available on the bus.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/VALID/POLARITY.Description: Polarity of the VALID bit that indicates that a codeword is available on the bus.

Options.1: High: VALID bit must be logical high.
Options.2: Low: VALID bit must be logical zero.
Options.3: Both: VALID bit may be logical high or zero.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/VALID/WIDTH.Description: Expected width of an active pulse on the VALID bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/DIO/VALUE.Description: Current value seen on the 32-bit DIO interface.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/ELF/CHECKSUM.Description: Checksum of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/0/ELF/DATA.Description: Contains the data of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/DATA.Description: Allows to write (using vectorWrite) or read (using getAsEvent) the selected waveform data at the selected index.

/DEV8018/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/DESCRIPTORS.Description: Displays various properties of the current waveform: name, filename, function, channels, length, segment, hash.

/DEV8018/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/INDEX.Description: Allows to select the index of the waveform in the waveform list for subsequent writing and reading.

/DEV8018/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Amount of the used waveform data relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 32 kSa of waveform data. Memory Usage over 100% means that waveforms must be loaded from the main memory (128 MSa per channel) during playback, which can lead to delays.

/DEV8018/AWGS/1/WAVEFORM/PLAYING.Description: When 1, indicates if a waveform is being played currently.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/0/CHANNEL.Description: Selects the digital trigger source signal.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/0/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/0/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/1/CHANNEL.Description: Selects the digital trigger source signal.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/1/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/AUXTRIGGERS/1/STATE.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/DATA.Description: A vector of 32-bit integers representing the values on the DIO interface as sampled by the AWG at 150 MHz.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/DELAY/INDEX.Description: Index of the bit on the DIO interface for which the delay should be changed.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/DELAY/VALUE.Description: Corresponding delay value to apply to the given bit of the DIO interface in units of 150 MHz clock cycles. Valid values are 0 to 3.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/ERROR/TIMING.Description: A 32-bit value indicating which bits on the DIO interface may have timing errors. A timing error is defined as an event where either the VALID or any of the data bits on the DIO interface change value at the same time as the STROBE bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/ERROR/WIDTH.Description: Indicates a width (i.e. jitter) error on either the STROBE (bit 0 of the value) or VALID bit (bit 1 of the result). A width error indicates that there was jitter detected on the given bit, meaning that an active period was either shorter or longer than the configured expected width.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/HIGHBITS.Description: 32-bit value indicating which bits on the 32-bit interface are detected as having a logic high value.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/LOWBITS.Description: 32-bit value indicating which bits on the 32-bit interface are detected as having a logic low value.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/MASK/SHIFT.Description: Defines the amount of bit shifting to apply for the DIO wave selection.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/MASK/VALUE.Description: Selects the DIO bits to be used for waveform selection in connection with playWaveDIO().

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/STATE.Description: When asserted, indicates that triggers are generated from the DIO interface to the AWG.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/STROBE/INDEX.Description: Selects the DIO index to be used as a trigger for the playback of a wave in connecton with waitDIOTrigger().

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/STROBE/SLOPE.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the strobe trigger.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/STROBE/WIDTH.Description: Specifies the expected width of active pulses on the STROBE bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/VALID/INDEX.Description: Index on the 32-bit of the DIO bus to be used as a VALID bit, i.e. a qualifier indicating that a valid codeword is available on the bus.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/VALID/POLARITY.Description: Polarity of the VALID bit that indicates that a codeword is available on the bus.

Options.1: High: VALID bit must be logical high.
Options.2: Low: VALID bit must be logical zero.
Options.3: Both: VALID bit may be logical high or zero.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/VALID/WIDTH.Description: Expected width of an active pulse on the VALID bit.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/DIO/VALUE.Description: Current value seen on the 32-bit DIO interface.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/CHECKSUM.Description: Checksum of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/DATA.Description: Contains the data of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/LENGTH.Description: Length of the compiled ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Size of the uploaded ELF file relative to the size of the main memory.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/NAME.Description: The name of the uploaded ELF file.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/ELF/PROGRESS.Description: The percentage of the sequencer program already uploaded to the device.

/DEV8018/AWGS/2/OUTPUTS/0/ENABLES/1.Description: Enables the driving of the given AWG output channel.

/DEV8018/AWGS/3/WAVEFORM/DATA.Description: Allows to write (using vectorWrite) or read (using getAsEvent) the selected waveform data at the selected index.

/DEV8018/AWGS/3/WAVEFORM/DESCRIPTORS.Description: Displays various properties of the current waveform: name, filename, function, channels, length, segment, hash.

/DEV8018/AWGS/3/WAVEFORM/INDEX.Description: Allows to select the index of the waveform in the waveform list for subsequent writing and reading.

/DEV8018/AWGS/3/WAVEFORM/MEMORYUSAGE.Description: Amount of the used waveform data relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 32 kSa of waveform data. Memory Usage over 100% means that waveforms must be loaded from the main memory (128 MSa per channel) during playback, which can lead to delays.

/DEV8018/AWGS/3/WAVEFORM/PLAYING.Description: When 1, indicates if a waveform is being played currently.

/DEV8018/CLOCKBASE.Description: Returns the internal clock frequency of the device.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/GATESELECT.Description: Select the signal source used for enabling the counter in the Gated Free Running and Gated modes.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/INTEGRATE.Description: Sum up counter values over time.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/MODE.Description: Select the run mode of the counter unit.

Options.1: Free Running: The counter runs on a repetitive time base defined by the Period field. At the beginning of each period the counter is reset, and at the end, the accumulated number of counts is output.
Options.2: Gated Free Running: The counter runs on a repetitive time base defined by the Period field. The Gate Input signal controls when the unit counter is allowed to run. The counter as well as the timer is reset when the Gate Input signal is low. The counter will only deliver new values if the Gate Input signal is high for a time longer than the configured Period.
Options.3: Gated: The counter is controlled with the Gate Input signal. The counter is enabled at the rising edge of the Gate Input signal and disabled at the falling edge. Pulses are counted as long as the counter is enabled. The accumulated number of counts is output on the falling edge of the Gate Input signal.
Options.4: Time Tagging: Every pulse is detected individually and tagged with the time of the event. The Period defines the minimum hold-off time between the tagging of two subsequent pulses. If more than one pulse occurs within the window defined by the Period, then the pulses are accumulated and output at the end of the window. The Period effectively determines the maximum rate at which pulse information can be transmitted to the host PC.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/OPERATION.Description: Select the arithmetic operation (addition, subtraction) applied to the counter unit outputs. 'Other counter' refers to the grouping of the counter units: 1 with 2, and 3 with 4.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/PERIOD.Description: Set the period used for the Free Running and Gated Free Running modes. Also sets the hold-off time for the Time Tagging mode.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/TRIGFALLING.Description: Performs a trigger event when the source signal crosses the trigger level from high to low. For dual edge triggering, select also the rising edge.

/DEV8018/CNTS/0/TRIGRISING.Description: Performs a trigger event when the source signal crosses the trigger level from low to high. For dual edge triggering, select also the falling edge.

/DEV8018/CNTS/1/GATESELECT.Description: Select the signal source used for enabling the counter in the Gated Free Running and Gated modes.

/DEV8018/DIOS/0/DRIVE.Description: When on (1), the corresponding 8-bit bus is in output mode. When off (0), it is in input mode. Bit 0 corresponds to the least significant byte. For example, the value 1 drives the least significant byte, the value 8 drives the most significant byte.

/DEV8018/DIOS/0/INPUT.Description: Gives the value of the DIO input for those bytes where drive is disabled.

/DEV8018/DIOS/0/INTERFACE.Description: Selects the interface standard to use on the 32-bit DIO interface. A value of 0 means that a 3.3 V CMOS interface is used. A value of 1 means that an LVDS compatible interface is used.

/DEV8018/DIOS/0/OUTPUT.Description: Sets the value of the DIO output for those bytes where 'drive' is enabled.

/DEV8018/FEATURES/CODE.Description: Node providing a mechanism to write feature codes.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/DELAY.Description: This value allows to delay the output of the signal in order to align waves.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/DIRECT.Description: Enables the direct output path. If enabled the signal will be fed directly from the DAC, reducing delay and noise. However, the range will be fixed and offset is not available any more.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/FILTER.Description: Enables a filter stage in the amplified path.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/MAX.Description: Maximum value transmitted to the DAC represented as a 16-bit integer in two's complement format.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/MIN.Description: Minimum value transmitted to the DAC represented as a 16-bit integer in two's complement format.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/OFFSET.Description: Defines the DC voltage that is added to the dynamic part of the output signal.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/ON.Description: Enabling/Disabling the Signal Output. Corresponds to the blue LED indicator on the instrument front panel.

/DEV8018/SIGOUTS/0/RANGE.Description: Sets the output voltage range. The instrument selects the next higher available range.

/DEV8018/SINES/0/AMPLITUDES/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the sine signal contributes to the signal output. Note that the last index is either 0 or 1 and will map to the pair of outputs given by the first index. (e.g. sines/3/amplitudes/0 corresponds to wave output 2)

/DEV8018/SINES/0/AMPLITUDES/1.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the sine signal contributes to the signal output. Note that the last index is either 0 or 1 and will map to the pair of outputs given by the first index. (e.g. sines/3/amplitudes/0 corresponds to wave output 2)

/DEV8018/SINES/0/ENABLES/0.Description: Enables the sine signal to the signal output. Note that the last index is either 0 or 1 and will map to the pair of outputs given by the first index. (e.g. sines/3/amplitudes/0 corresponds to wave output 2)

/DEV8018/SINES/0/ENABLES/1.Description: Enables the sine signal to the signal output. Note that the last index is either 0 or 1 and will map to the pair of outputs given by the first index. (e.g. sines/3/amplitudes/0 corresponds to wave output 2)

/DEV8018/SINES/0/HARMONIC.Description: Multiplies the sine signals's reference frequency with the integer factor defined by this field.

/DEV8018/SINES/0/OSCSELECT.Description: Select oscillator for generation of this sine signal.

/DEV8018/SINES/0/PHASESHIFT.Description: Phase shift applied to sine signal.

/DEV8018/SINES/1/AMPLITUDES/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the sine signal contributes to the signal output. Note that the last index is either 0 or 1 and will map to the pair of outputs given by the first index. (e.g. sines/3/amplitudes/0 corresponds to wave output 2)

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/BANDWIDTH.Description: Command streaming bandwidth usage on the physical network connection between device and data server.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/BYTESRECEIVED.Description: Number of bytes received on the command stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/BYTESSENT.Description: Number of bytes sent on the command stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PACKETSLOST.Description: Number of command packets lost since device start. Command packets contain device settings that are sent to and received from the device.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PACKETSRECEIVED.Description: Number of packets received on the command stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PACKETSSENT.Description: Number of packets sent on the command stream to the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PENDING.Description: Number of buffers ready for receiving command packets from the device.

/DEV8018/STATS/CMDSTREAM/PROCESSING.Description: Number of buffers being processed for command packets. Small values indicate proper performance. For a TCP/IP interface, command packets are sent using the TCP protocol.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/BANDWIDTH.Description: Data streaming bandwidth usage on the physical network connection between device and data server.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/BYTESRECEIVED.Description: Number of bytes received on the data stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/PACKETSLOST.Description: Number of data packets lost since device start. Data packets contain measurement data.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/PACKETSRECEIVE.Description: Number of packets received on the data stream from the device since session start.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/PENDING.Description: Number of buffers ready for receiving data packets from the device.

/DEV8018/STATS/DATASTREAM/PROCESSING.Description: Number of buffers being processed for data packets. Small values indicate proper performance. For a TCP/IP interface, data packets are sent using the UDP protocol.

/DEV8018/STATUS/ADC0MAX.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms.

/DEV8018/STATUS/ADC0MIN.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms

/DEV8018/STATUS/ADC1MAX.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms.

/DEV8018/STATUS/ADC1MIN.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms

/DEV8018/STATUS/FIFOLEVEL.Description: USB FIFO level: Indicates the USB FIFO fill level inside the device. When 100%, data is lost

/DEV8018/STATUS/FLAGS/BINARY.Description: A set of binary flags giving an indication of the state of various parts of the device. Bit 11: Sample Loss.

/DEV8018/STATUS/FLAGS/PACKETLOSSTCP.Description: Flag indicating if tcp packages have been lost.

/DEV8018/STATUS/FLAGS/PACKETLOSSUDP.Description: Flag indicating if udp packages have been lost.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/ACTIVEINTERFACE.Description: Currently active interface of the device.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/AWG/CHANNELGROUPING.Description: Sets the channel grouping mode of the device.

Options.0: Use the outputs in groups of 2. One sequencer program controls 2 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0..4/).
Options.1: Use the outputs in groups of 4. One sequencer program controls 4 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0/ and /dev..../awgs/2/)
Options.2: Use the outputs in groups of 8. One sequencer program controls 8 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0/). Requires 8 channel device.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/BOARDREVISIONS/0.Description: Hardware revision of the FPGA base board

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/BOARDREVISIONS/1.Description: Hardware revision of the analog board

Options.0: Internal clock is used as the frequency and time base reference.
Options.1: An external 10-MHz clock is used as the frequency and time base reference. Provide a clean and stable 10 MHz reference to the appropriate back panel connector.

Options.0: Reference clock has been locked on.
Options.1: There was an error locking onto the reference clock signal. After an error the source is automatically switched back to internal reference clock.
Options.2: The device is busy trying to lock onto the reference clock signal.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/FWLOGENABLE.Description: Enables logging to the fwlog node.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/FWREVISION.Description: Revision of the device internal controller software

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/IDENTIFY.Description: Setting this node to 1 will cause the device to blink the power led for a few seconds.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/DEFAULTGATEWAY.Description: Default gateway configuration for the network connection.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/DEFAULTIP4.Description: IPv4 address of the device to use if static IP is enabled.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/DEFAULTMASK.Description: IPv4 mask in case of static IP.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/MAC.Description: Current MAC address of the device network interface.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/SAVEIP.Description: If written, this action will program the defined static IP address to the device.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/NICS/0/STATIC.Description: Enable this flag if the device is used in a network with fixed IP assignment without a DHCP server.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/OWNER.Description: Returns the current owner of the device (IP).

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PORTTCP.Description: Returns the current TCP port used for communication to the dataserver.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PORTUDP.Description: Returns the current UDP port used for communication to the dataserver.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/POWERCONFIGDATE.Description: Contains the date of power configuration (format is: (year << 16) | (month << 8) | day)

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/FREQRESOLUTIO.Description: The number of bits used to represent a frequency.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/FREQSCALING.Description: The scale factor to use to convert a frequency represented as a freqresolution-bit integer to a floating point value.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/MAXFREQ.Description: The maximum oscillator frequency that can be set.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/MAXTIMECONSTA.Description: The maximum demodulator time constant that can be set.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/MINFREQ.Description: The minimum oscillator frequency that can be set.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/MINTIMECONSTA.Description: The minimum demodulator time constant that can be set.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/NEGATIVEFREQ.Description: Indicates whether negative frequencies are supported.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/PROPERTIES/TIMEBASE.Description: Minimal time difference between two timestamps. Is equal to 1/(maximum sampling rate).

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/SAVEPORTS.Description: Flag indicating that the TCP and UDP ports should be saved.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/SHUTDOWN.Description: Sending a '1' to this node initiates a shutdown of the operating system on the MFLI device. It is recommended to trigger this shutdown before switching the device off with the hardware switch at the back side of the device.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/SLAVEREVISION.Description: HDL firmware revision of the slave FPGA.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/STALL.Description: Indicates if the network connection is stalled.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/STATUS.Description: Textual node used by the device to send critical error information as JSON data structure to the server.

/DEV8018/SYSTEM/UPDATE.Description: Requests update of the device firmware and bitstream from the dataserver.
